A5: A tricky one. I always find when something is compulsary, I automatically don't want to do it as much... #digitaledchat
A4: learning WITH students. Share the journey by sitting down and exploring an app TOGETHER instead of "this is how you..." #digitaledchat

Student action in 1H. There's even a section for books written by students! #pypchat #inquiry #pyp https://t.co/169VAzgpDJ
@s1lverdragon This would be something to discuss with your child's class teacher as I can't speak for what they do :)
@s1lverdragon I think that is why there is so much debate on this topic. It has to be purposeful. Also, children need time to be children!
A3: Yes, yes, yes! Who are we to say where they are in their learning journey. #MYEdOz
@dione_robinson I see Ss setting a goal, saying what they could do to work towards it and then reflecting on how they went. #MYEdOz
@dione_robinson Must admit I haven't tried this yet as it's something I have been thinking about just recently!
@phil_amos Exactly. To me, "work" suggests being kept busy with no end in sight!
@niallkinsella Awww so cute!!
A2: Have Ss set their own. Shows them reflecting on learning and makes it much more purposeful. #MYEdOz
We call HW "Home Learning" as the very notion of "work" is enough to demotivate Ss before they've even begun! #MYEdOz
A1: Cons: When told WHAT to learn, Ss taking action with learning diminishes. It becomes a chore. #MYEdOz
Hi all. Fiona in Canberra. Really keen to see peoples thoughts on this! #MYEdOz
Does over-reporting label students unfairly? https://t.co/KuIHT7soAO

A1: Because "joy is in the journey, not the destination". Mistake-making is seen as an integral part of learning. #myedoz #PBL

Ok. This I love. #inquiry https://t.co/zLyRPWGDfU
@s1lverdragon Definitely! We do this via @Seesaw. Great way to connect parents to learning!
@stuartkellynz Baha! Thanks for a great chat #digitaledchat
A5: It can't! When used authentically of course... #digitaledchat
A4: Go digital to document those wonderful hands-on experiences, record Ss thinking, assessment! @seesaw is great! #digitaledchat
A3: Maybe not so much teaching as making connections to and appreciating - we can all do that by naturally integrating. #digitaledchat
@curly48 Numerate! Now there's a word I rarely hear...#digitaledchat
@curly48 I think we often forget that we need to teach this! Model and scaffold! It is another language after all :) #digitaledchat
@stuartkellynz @cazgirn So many Ss saying "I don't need to know this". We need to show them its value from the start! #digitaledchat
A2: It involves SO many skills: communication, problem-solving, research, critical thinking to name a mere few. #digitaledchat
A1: it's all about student thinking and relatability. WHY did you use that strategy? HOW do we apply this in every day life? #digitaledchat
